data.name: Apple Watch Alerts do not update without opening the app on the phone

description.body:
When an alert come through to the Apple Watch, if the app is installed on the watch, you can select the alert to go into the app. However, once in the app on the watch, the new alert doesn't load/show until the app is opened on the phone. 

Follow up when it was promoted:

09:16]
bryan For https://active911.aha.io/ideas/A911BUG-I-239 did changing continuous repage have any effect?

[09:19]
jamiesuter Do you mean that if I turn on re-paging, will it work? Or are you asking if this was caused by the latest change with re-paging?

[09:19]
bryan The first one

[09:30]
jamiesuter Yes, that helps. However, it doesn't stop the re-paging, so when I first select the alert, it sits there trying to load, then another notification pops up, I select that, it takes me back into the app on the watch, the call is now listed, I select the call to see more info, I get another notification

[09:32]
jamiesuter I select the notification again, that takes me back into the app where I can see more alert info, but the notifications keep coming through

data.name: As an iOS 11 user w/ a CE/5S device I would like to see all of the call details.

description.body:
This is basically the exact same problem described by AC-1000... but now for iPhone instead of iPad.

Also described in OTRS ticket: 2017121824000243

Basically it is only showing up as a problem on the older phones with the smaller screen size that have upgraded to iOS 11.

 

The Plan:

The solution as described by Robert (and in his commit for the iPad fix) requires some work with the constraints in the troublesome part of the view (in the storyboard) to get them set up perfectly (we may be able to just compare the iPad and iPhone storyboards in this case).

data.name: Devices are searchable by membership device names that don't match the current agency searching them

description.body:
When a device is a member of two agencies and has an agency specific name for each agency. The device is searchable in the device tab only by one of those agency specific names.

For instance, if device1 is a member of agency1 and agency2. And device1 is named 'Bob' on agency1 and named 'Fred' on agency2. Then you can go to the device tab for each agency and search for 'Bob' and each agency will show you device1 where as if you search for 'Fred' on either agency's device tab, you will get nothing. This is particularly problematic when an agency cannot find a device that is a part of it.

data.name: Refresh lag after moving a map data point

description.body: After moving a point on the map via drag and drop, it takes a second for the location to refresh through the system. If you are not aware of this and try editing the details (like icon or color) the changes will be made, but the icon will return to previous location. Sometimes it will give you an "Error: Unauthorized" message instead.

product.name: Bugs for Active911 For First Responders

custom_fields.name: Steps to Reproduce
custom_fields.body:
Long hold on a point and drag it to a new location.

Immediately select the the point after you have confirmed the change and select to edit it. 

Check to see if it registered the correct point. If not, it will probably give you the "Error: Unauthorized" message after you select save. 

If it did register the correct point, edit it and save. The point should jump back to it's last location if you tried to edit it fast enough.

description.body:
Assigning devices to assignments from the scheduling tab does not work at all.

custom_fields.name: Steps to Reproduce
custom_fields.body:
1) Get any client app as a test device and set it's assignment for an agency to Automatic.

2) Go the the web interface for that agency and create a scheduled assignment for that device. The assignment can start the day before and end the day after the current day. You can also create a schedule that starts in the future and patiently wait for it to start. 

3) The device only gets notified of scheduled assignments when it starts up, so kill the app and start it up again. Check what assignment your device is under in the personnel screen.  The device will be listed under unassigned.

data.name: Webview may fail to reconnect once disconnected.

description.body:
[User] From Ticket#2017061410000431

David called in with Comcast techs present at his location. They were
monitoring their connection and said there were no issues with dropped
packets, the firewall was disabled, and no ports were being blocked.

He can connect for a while, and then it disconnects and won't reconnect
without refreshing the page.

We have seen this before, but we can't reliably replicate it. David has
Webview running on a Mac using Chrome.


[ Alex ]  

I spoke with Jon about this yesterday, and we decided that even if we spent time trying to recreate this issue we probably wouldn't be able to get it to happen. We have the customer screenshots of the problem which I added in a comment so we know that it's happening, and they already ran through the normal troubleshooting steps of checking their internet connection and ports

At this point it would probably be easiest to implement a catchall solution like refreshing the page if the reconnect fails some number of times

data.name: The Windows PC app must be restarted before new calls popluate.

description.body:
When a new call comes in, the app must be restarted before the information is visible in the app

[ Ryan ] 

I was able to reliably reproduce this bug as well. The problem is just that the app no longer reconnects to XMPP if it loses it's connection.

More detailed steps to reproduce:

1. Open the pc app (and register if this is the first time opening the app).

2. Turn on debug features and open logging window.

3. Verify that there is periodic XMPP communication (at minimum there will be a ping w/ both a Send & Receive.)

4. Disconnect device from the internet.

5. Wait and watch the log until you see a couple of pings and then "SAFELY HANDLED IOException on TcpSocket" and a blank "XMPP Recv:" (shouldn't take more than a minute).

6. Reconnect to the internet.

7. Now the app will no longer receive alerts until it is restarted.

data.name: Update on duplicate does not work for forwarded alerts

description.body:
When an agency is setup to forward all of its alerts to another agency, we do not update any of the agencies that have been forwarded to if it is a dupe. Instead the agencies that receive the forward receive the update as if it was a brand new alert. This doesn't match how the alert comes through normally for these agencies.

 

In the alert server this functionality is referred to as pagegroup daisychain.

When the alert is being processed, we determine if it is a duplicate in the normalize subroutine of the Normalizer. At this point we know that the alert is a duplicate and operate accordingly depending on the settings for the original agency. After this we handle the daisychaining of the alert in the process subroutine in the Processor. When processing all of the daisychain we do not do any checks or special logic to determin a dupe or check if the forwarded agencies have settings regarding duplicates. We simple create a new alert with a new Id and a copy of all of the original alerts information.

duplicates.name: Update on duplicate does not work for forwarded alerts

description.body: `Only previously alerted` option does not work when editing an alert from a client. The client sends `-1` as the pagegroup to the access-server which I believe is correct, but somewhere in that process, the alert never gets sent and the access-server returns success.

product.name: Bugs for Active911 For First Responders

duplicate_of.name: Devices are searchable by membership device names that don't match the current agency searching them

description.body:
When a device is a member of two agencies and has an agency specific name for each agency. The device is searchable in the device tab only by one of those agency specific names.

For instance, if device1 is a member of agency1 and agency2. And device1 is named 'Bob' on agency1 and named 'Fred' on agency2. Then you can go to the device tab for each agency and search for 'Bob' and each agency will show you device1 where as if you search for 'Fred' on either agency's device tab, you will get nothing. This is particularly problematic when an agency cannot find a device that is a part of it.

product.name: Bugs for Active911 For First Responders

custom_fields.name: Steps to Reproduce
custom_fields.body:
1. Add a device called Abraham to the Active911 Test Agency.

2. Add the device to the Corvallis FD as a multiple use device.

3. Edit the device on the Corvallis FD account to be named Bob.

4. Go back to the Active911 Test Agency and search for the device using the filter box, and the device's name on the account, Abraham. The device doesn't show.

5. Search for the name Bob on the Test Agency account, and the device showed up, even though the name says it is Bob.

data.name: Aha SSO is on the wrong port (5443) instead of 443.

product.name: Bugs for Active911 For First Responders

custom_fields.name: Severity
custom_fields.value: 3. Minor Functionality Does Not Work as Expected

custom_fields.name: Priority
custom_fields.value: 2. Fix At the earliest convenience. Not quite right, but workable.

custom_fields.name: Triaged
custom_fields.value: Approved, confirmed bug

custom_fields.name: Bug Type
custom_fields.value: Missed, a bug introduced by poor/unknown requirements

custom_fields.name: Steps to Reproduce
custom_fields.body:
I was excited to learn about the new ideas.active911.com site, however I ran
into some difficulties trying to access it.  Upon entering my email address,
I get redirected to a URL that starts with
https://sso.active911.com:5443/simplesaml/saml2/idp/SSOService.php?SAMLRequ[..].

Unfortunately for me, this URL points to TCP port 5443 rather than the
standard https port 443.  Most users who access your site through a corporate
firewall or proxy server (like me when I'm in my office) will not be able to
reach that URL because it runs on a non-standard port.  I realize
rearchitecting the service to use port 443 may take some work, but I wanted
to bring this to your attention as I'm not sure how many other customers
(particularly in larger agencies) might be impacted.

data.name: Update on duplicate does not work for forwarded alerts

description.body: `Only previously alerted` option does not work when editing an alert from a client. The client sends `-1` as the pagegroup to the access-server which I believe is correct, but somewhere in that process, the alert never gets sent and the access-server returns success.

duplicate_of.name: Update on duplicate does not work for forwarded alerts

description.body:
When an agency is setup to forward all of its alerts to another agency, we do not update any of the agencies that have been forwarded to if it is a dupe. Instead the agencies that receive the forward receive the update as if it was a brand new alert. This doesn't match how the alert comes through normally for these agencies.

 

In the alert server this functionality is referred to as pagegroup daisychain.

When the alert is being processed, we determine if it is a duplicate in the normalize subroutine of the Normalizer. At this point we know that the alert is a duplicate and operate accordingly depending on the settings for the original agency. After this we handle the daisychaining of the alert in the process subroutine in the Processor. When processing all of the daisychain we do not do any checks or special logic to determin a dupe or check if the forwarded agencies have settings regarding duplicates. We simple create a new alert with a new Id and a copy of all of the original alerts information.

data.name: Editing an Alert sent to pagegroups does not handle sending to individuals

description.body:
Per Tyler:

Britt and I found an issue with the alert processing while troubleshooting a different
issue on an account. We added our devices to the account and sent out a test message. We
then selected the alert and updated it. Under recipients, we selected the option for
direct recipients only. After saving the call, the call correctly showed that I had
updated the call as the new source, however the call did not go out to devices. When
checking the logs, it said that our devices were not a member of the pagegroup, even
though we selected direct recipients and put our devices on the recipients list.

http://alert1-tx.active911.com/webservice/agency/0002142/201607
http://alert1-tx.active911.com/webservice/alert/00-02-14-2-201607-146791376[..]

2016-07-07 17:49:23.330 info Not sending to device 104947 (not member of pagegroup)
2016-07-07 17:49:23.330 info Not sending to device 164810 (not member of pagegroup)

data.name: The Android app stopped sending it's response in or showing accurate reports while beta testing

description.body: The app was doing good with responses for quite a while, but towards the end of testing, the responses stopped updating.

product.name: Bugs for Active911 For First Responders

feature.name: The report shows no data available occasionally

custom_fields.name: Priority
custom_fields.value: 1. Must Fix. Directly impacts our reliability or trustworthiness.

custom_fields.name: Contact Email Address
custom_fields.value: tyler.lyman@active911.com

custom_fields.name: Steps to Reproduce
custom_fields.body:
1. Opened a call in the app and selected a response. Response appeared to update on the device , but report showed no data available. A secondary device was not seeing the updated status either. The database confirmed that no response was being received by the device. Navigated to another app to confirm internet access was good and was successfully able to use other apps online. Restarted the app and the issue changed to the app just hanging on the response pending animation. This was replicated on both cell data and WiFi.

 

Eventually the app started working again, and am not able to reproduce at this moment.

data.name: abot needs standardized formats for commands

description.body:
As an example, the below subset of abot commands for subscriptions have a varied format. Some require <'ticket number + notes'> and some just require <ticket number>. Abot command formats need to be consistent for support to better remember the list of commands, which ones need '  ' around the ticket numbers, etc, so that we don't have to always look up the commands.

  • abot subscription expire <subscription id> <y|n> - Expire a subscription based on its id.  Append y to perform the action.
  • abot subscription extend <subscription id> <new_date> <new_time> <Ticket#> <y|n> - Update a subscriptions expiration date.  Format should be in yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss format.  Time should also be in GMT (PST +8:00).  Append y to perform the action.
  • abot subscription split <subscription_id> <originating_agency_id> give <number_of_devices> to <receiving_agency_id> <auto|manual> <'Ticket# and additional notes'>.  Subscription id and originating agency are the subscription being split.  Number of devices is the number to be removed from the original subscription and given to the new agency.  Auto attempts to assign those subscriptions to devices, manual does not touch the devices.  Append y to perform the action.
  • abot subscription switch <subscription_id> from <user_id> to <agency_id> <'Ticket# + notes'>.  Subscription id and user_id are for the current subscription. Agency_id is the target agency, it must not already have a subscription.  Append y to perform the action.
    abot subscription update devices <subscription id> <new_number_of_devices> <Ticket#> <y|n> - Update a subscriptions total number of devices.  Append y to perform the action.
  • abot subscription upgrade <agency_id> <devices_to_add_count> <check|cc> <amount> <check_number_or_cc_transaction> <y|n> - add devices to subscription

data.name: pc app only displays partial set of map icon pins for a particular agency

description.body:
The easiest way for me to describe this problem is in relation to how this feature of the map works on some of our other platforms (e.g. iOS). So basically as you pan/zoom the map around, on each refresh the app is calculating the visible frame, and will display icons inside the frame (also loading them from access server if necessary), and will hide icons outside of the frame (off screen).

In this particular instance (see video in OTRS ticket or try it yourself via 'steps to reproduce') the app is acting like it has calculated a visible frame which doesn't actually match the current map view window (it's too small & only icons in the middle of the map are being displayed).

data.name: Response options may fail silently under poor internet conditions

description.body: [Paul ] When there's a bad connection (like when switching networks), a response may fail to send and silently retry with no user feedback. The buttons get re-enabled, but none are highlighted (at least at first), even though the response may still go through. This is where the user gets frustrated by the lack of feedback and taps the button again, sending another response.

product.name: Bugs for Active911 For First Responders

custom_fields.name: Priority
custom_fields.value: 2. Fix At the earliest convenience. Not quite right, but workable.

custom_fields.name: Environment
custom_fields.value: Production (Store app, production data)

custom_fields.name: Steps to Reproduce
custom_fields.body:
on iOS:

  • Find a zone of dead internet, for me this is usually walking away from the building until I hit that zone where wifi is connected, but out of usable range.
  • hit a response to an alert.
  • The client will silently retry, and sometimes be successful.

Expected: if we successfully send a response, I would expect the button to become marked.

Actual: The response is sent, but the client does not update the button.  It looks like no response has been recorded, even if it has.

data.name: Web Interface - Unable to delete a user with a single quote in their email

description.body:
If you try to delete a user with an email that has a quote in it (e.g. "o'conner@email.com"), it fails to delete and returns an SQL error. It seems like this would be because we aren't escaping that field, but it looks like we do escape it from the code. There may be a codepath that skips the escaping, but I couldn't find it with a cursory inspection. This is happening in the "save_users" function in interface.ajax.php.

 

It's easy to work around this issue. However it could potentially be used to exectute arbitrary SQL statements as a customer on our web interface. That's a huge security hole, so I'm giving this a higher priority than I would otherwise.

When I am removed from an agency, I can no longer download the unread_messages for that agency.

The unread_messages still show up in my get_all_volatile_data, causing my app to try to download them everytime I open the app.

This causes lag if I have a lot of unread messages.

Update the query for get_all_volatile_data so that it doesn't get unread_messages which are for agencies I am no longer a part of.

data.name: QA Android - Conflicting Duty Status Between App and Web Console

description.body:
Changing the duty status within the app updates the duty status within the web console. Changing the duty status within the web console doesn't update the duty status within the app. Your device can have conflicting duty statuses.

If I want my device to be off duty, I would need to make sure it is set to off duty within the app as well as in the web console.

data.name: Missing responses on iOS

description.body:
The problem happens when we fetch an alert via get all volatile data. If the alert doesn't already exist on the device (fetch wasn't triggered during APN), the responses are applied before the the alerts finish downloading.

1a. deviceHasUnreadMessages -> async -> 1b. fetchAlertUsingMessageID

2. updateAlertResponses

1b ends up happening before 2 and so the fetched alerts are missing these responses.

Run "steps to reproduce" debug the above function calls to get a more detailed view of the problem.

custom_fields.name: Steps to Reproduce
custom_fields.body:
Steps to reproduce on iOS:

  1. App is installed and registered with device code
  2. App needs to be force closed OR backgrounded with background app refresh turned off
    1. Force closed: double tap home button and slide preview of the app up to close it
    2. Background app refresh turned off: Settings->Active911->Background App Refresh
  3. Send an alert to at least 3 devices including this primary test device.
    1. The other two devices can be any other app known to not have this problem or an iOS device that isn’t in the state described in (2).
  4. Respond to the alert on the other two test devices and verify that they both show two responses.
  5. Open the app on the primary test device.
  6. You should see the alert appear as it is downloaded.
  7. Open the alert.
  8. It will initially show 0 responses and then just the one response from itself.
  9. The report will have a record of the responses from the other two devices

data.name: Alert Server - Unable to properly interpret a nested message

description.body:
A conversation I had with Tier 3 at the time of the problem.

Jon recommends adding a JSON option to the agency to change where we attempt to grab a content at a certain spot, then default to the first if we find nothing.

So I would lean towards a JSON option and adding a parameter to the MessageExtract library

[10:47]
which defaults to the current behavior so it wouldn't change anything for anyone else

 

 

** Full Conversation **

jonathan [10:40]
if we wanted to make a fix on our side, we would need to add a parameter to the specify which of the parts with the same name to take, as long as the ordering remained consistent

bryan [10:41] 

no way to take it all, is there?

jonathan [10:41]
we could concatenate all text, but that would change how it works for other agencies possibly

bryan [10:42]
is there a query to find out?

[10:42]
probably not, we aren’t storing the raw_messages in the database

jonathan [10:43]
we would need to iterate through the alert log files on the alert servers

bryan [10:43]
we do have a new spiffy centralized repo of logs though, right?

[10:44]
we have…json options?

jonathan [10:44]
its just a big file system. it doesnt speed it up much

[10:44]
in this case

[10:44]
also its only in dev atm

bryan [10:44]
thats fine

[10:45]
just eliminating options

jonathan [10:45]
basically we need to either devise a solution that doesn't affect the output for all of our current customers, or we need to add a flag/option of some sort to the agency and then have that trigger a change in the way we parse the email

[10:46]
if we make a change that affects output, we will need to rerun all the poly tests to generate new hashes

bryan [10:46]
that would suck ass

[10:46]
and we wouldn’t be sure something didn’t get missed

jonathan [10:47]
So I would lean towards a JSON option and adding a parameter to the MessageExtract library

[10:47]
which defaults to the current behavior so it wouldn't change anything for anyone else

data.name: Access Server -  iOS changing shift does not update prev_shift_id

description.body:
prev_shift_id does not appear to be set in the the access server anywhere. It looks like it should be set everytime a shift is changed since we use it for the auto shift option.

So, prev_shift_id should not be set by changing a shift. It is a poorly named column in the database. prev_shift_id is set only by the web-interface and is used for the auto shift option.

data.name: iOS "none" pagegroup can remove pagegroup zero from the device

description.body:
Removing all pagegroups causes the iOS app to generate a "none" pagegroup that is selected.  Then it can be used to unsubscribe from pagegroup zero.

According to https://github.com/active911/devops/wiki/How-Do-Pagegroups-Work%3F pagegroup zero should be constant.

PM: I would remove the logic that automatically adds a "none" pagegroup.  The user should know by scrolling through selected options.

data.name: Using the prefix Method for pagegroups causes duplicate detection to work oddly.

product.name: Bugs for Active911 For First Responders

custom_fields.name: Priority
custom_fields.value: 2. Fix At the earliest convenience. Not quite right, but workable.

custom_fields.name: Severity
custom_fields.value: 2. Major Functionality Does Not Work as Expected

custom_fields.name: Bug Type
custom_fields.value: Defect, a bug introduced with new code

custom_fields.name: Triaged
custom_fields.value: Investigating

custom_fields.name: Steps to Reproduce
custom_fields.body:
From Tyler:

When an agency can't send through units, they have to send the calls directly to
pagegroups using the prefix method. When a call goes out to multiple units, it sends
multiple emails to the relevant pagegroups. When we receive the messages, we treat them
all as new calls, disregarding the duplicate update and discard options they have set.
This causes problems when 4 stations (groups) are all dispatched on the same call, but
Active911 shows it as 4 new calls.

data.name: iOS can receive null values in map locations, causing crashes when referenced

description.body:
non utf-8 chars in db causing access servers json_encode to not return valid json.

I haven't been able to pin it down to the specific set of characters which can cause the issue, but here's a current example of one that will fail:

The description field from location_id 9933675 (in table "locations");

product.name: Bugs for Active911 For First Responders

feature.name: As [ Jon Snow, the anonymous user who reported this ], I want to [ make sure my iOS app does not crash when bad stuff comes from the access server ], so that I can [ not have my iOS app crash when I need it most ].

custom_fields.body:
The description field from location_id 9933675 (in table "locations");

 

On one of our iOS devices (dev ipad air 2), this location was being received from the access server with NULL for the description -> which keeps it from creating a valid alert object (with multiple null fields, including location_id) -> which then causes a crash when this null location_id is used elsewhere in the app.

When I tested the access server more directly (POST get_location and get_locations json datatype), I received invalid json errors.

data.name: Google Map in iOS crashes with too many markers on screen

description.body:
The error message from xcode is: "Reached the max number of texture atlases, can not allocate more."

This is an issue/limitation with how we are using the Google Maps SDK (too many unique GMSMarker/UIImages). Prior to reaching the limit (crash), performance also diminishes greatly (down to ~1-5 fps).

Also worth noting, looking at the available crash reports for iOS, this is currently the #1 cause of crashes, with 643 in the past 2 weeks (#2 coming in at 111). So that should provide a pretty good incentive for expediting this one.

TODO
While working on this bug, first try to recreate it in a testing env, by creating 100+ unique markers in a loop within the mapviewcontroller. From my init research, you should try to do this with devices instead of locations, with unique icons/callouts/text.

data.name: FFRS Integration Blocking New Active911 Customers

description.body:
This may be a misunderstanding of the proper workflow or an oversight with our recent FFRS integration.

Basically if an FFRS agency is imported into our DB along with it's firefighters (added as devices in our system), and then if they want to try Active911, another agency is created in our system with the same name and some of the same devices. But since devices must be uniquely identified by phone number, they can't be added as new devices for the new Agency.

similarly, if one of the new active911 users logs in... a login is automatically created for the ffrs agency as well (as long as they have a device in that agency with their email address), and so that user will have access to both agencies and will be confused as to which is which.

might be worth including this issue as well in this ticket (not as high of a priority as the others, though)

issue from ticket: 2016122810000476
“He also said that some guys are putting in their phone numbers and the emails are going to a myffrs.com email address.”

The problem here is that a password reset via phone number finds the first device with a given phone number, which in some cases could be the devices that belong to the beta/kangaroo agency which may have Jason’s email for the reason mentioned above (If the FFRS users don’t have email addresses, the exporter uses Jason’s email at this step). What would be decent solution for this? Perhaps either not using jason’s email as the default in the FFRS exporter script or changing the send_password_reset_email to pick an email address other than jason’s?

data.name: Editing a device in the pagegroups tab does not display the proper device name

description.body:
A user may see the wrong device name (one for another agency) in this dialogue. 

 

So we need to either fix this in the get_pagegroups call or in the UI elements that use the data returned from the call (should include both the device name and the agency specific device names at this point... but in some places we not using the agency_device_name i.e. tokenInput). I tried a quick fix but noticed that there were a few other places where is still wasn't updating (prepopulate, add, & autocomplete), so I think we should be a bit more thorough and make sure we get to the root of this.

product.name: Bugs for Active911 For First Responders

feature.name: Editing a device in the pagegroups tab does not display the proper device name

custom_fields.name: Steps to Reproduce
custom_fields.body:
Steps to reproduce: 

1.Need to have a device added to two different agencies.

2.Make an edit to that device on one of your agencies on the web-interface.

3.Switch to your other agency.

4.Go to the groups tabs and tap to edit a pagegroup that contains the device.

5. In the case mentioned in the ticket and when I did the same thing with my test agencies, the device name in the members field list didn't have the correct agency specific name. 

6. Note - additionally if I then edited/saved the device in this current agency and tried steps 4-5 again, the problem was resolved.

data.name: Editing a map data bug sometimes causes it to revert to a previous location.

custom_fields.body:

data.name: Response Options not updating consistently in iOS

description.body:
Current behavior:

If you change the agency response options via the web-interface:

  1. The response options for an alert detail view in the iOS app will update after the app is backgrounded and reopened (get all volatile data)
  2. The response options in the APN when app isn’t open (banner or lockscreen) will update after the app is force closed and reopened (set during app initial start up).

Desired behavior:

Ideally we would like these to update without the app changing state.

Alternatively as a half measure we could make sure that both of these places where the response options are visible update at the same time (during the same app state change).

product.name: Bugs for Active911 For First Responders

Copying a redmine bug:
